DOC.brief_summary: The aim study investigate whether urinary catheterization could avoid patient undergo total knee arthroplasty combine spinal-epidural analgesia plus multi-site infiltration analgesia .
DOC.brief_title: To Catheterize Not ? Total Knee Arthroplasty With Combined Spinal-epidural Analgesia
DOC.criteria: Aged 40 year old , schedule primary TKA endstage osteoarthritis willing able return followup least 1month postoperative period . Revisions , bilateral procedure , surgical history urinary system , urinary tract infection systematical condition ( renal disease , renal failure , chronic renal insufficiency , indwell catheter time surgery ) need intraoperative monitoring urine output .
